# üì¶ Contributing to Bert XIV

Here is a guide to get you started with helping out.

## ‚ùó Code of Conduct

Read [CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/FRC-4750-Bishop-Eustace/Bert-XIV/blob/main/.github/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md) for information on our code of conduct.

## üêõ Reporting Bugs

If you spot a bug in any code, please create a GitHub issue on the Bert XIV repository and include as much detail as possible. Make sure to include the following:

- A clear and descriptive title.
- Steps to reproduce the issue.
- Expected behaviour and what acctually happens.
- Any relevant logs and/or screenshots.
- Any other additional details that you think should be included.

[Submit a bug](https://github.com/FRC-4750-Bishop-Eustace/Bert-XIV/issues/new)

## üí° Suggesting Features

Feature requests are appreciated!

Notify any collaborators to get editor access or to push requests.

## ‚öíÔ∏è Contributing Code

### üöÄ Getting Started

1. Fork the Bert XIV repository.
2. Clone your fork.
3. Create a new branch for your changes.
4. Make your change(s) and commit them.
5. Request a collaborator to accept your pull request.

### ‚ÜïÔ∏è Pull Request Guidelines

- Follow the coding style of the project (look at [Style
  Guide](https://github.com/FRC-4750-Bishop-Eustace/Bert-XIV/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#style-guide) for more info).
- Write clear and descriptive comments and commit messages.
- Inlude 1 or more tests of your new feature(s) or fixes.
- Ensure that your code passes all tests and is bug-free before submission.

[Submit a pull request](https://github.com/FRC-4750-Bishop-Eustace/Bert-XIV/compare)

## üõ†Ô∏è Setting Up the development enviroment

### üß∞ Prerequisites

- [Install Git](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git)
- [Install Python](https://www.python.org/downloads/)
- [Install RobotPy](https://frcdocs.wpi.edu/en/stable/docs/zero-to-robot/step-2/python-setup.html)

> [!NOTE]
> Read the main [README](https://github.com/FRC-4750-Bishop-Eustace/Bert-XIV/blob/main/README.md) for more information on platform specific requirements

### ‚öôÔ∏è Installation

1. Clone the Bert XIV repository.
2. Navigate to the projects directory.
3. Install dependencies (if required).

### ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Testing and Running your project

1. Navigate to the repo directory.
2. Run either the VSCode launch configuration.
